headline: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Tesla, Sunrun, Robinhood, Wolfspeed, Las Vegas Sands, Progress Software, and More
summary: The  rose sharply after the Senate narrowly passed President Donald Trump’s tax-and-spending bill.  CEO Elon Musk criticized Trump’s bill, calling it “utterly insane and destructive,” while the president suggested that the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE)–the department Musk helped run until the end of May–should look into his companies’ government subsidies.  Sunrun  jumped 11%,  SolarEdge Technologies  rose 7.2%, and solar and wind stocks soared as Republican legislators stripped an excise tax on renewable energy projects from Trump’s bill.

CEO Elon Musk criticized Trump’s bill, calling it “utterly insane and destructive,” while the president suggested that the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE)–the department Musk helped run until the end of May–should look into his companies’ government subsidies.  Sunrun  jumped 11%,  SolarEdge Technologies  rose 7.2%, and solar and wind stocks soared as Republican legislators stripped an excise tax on renewable energy projects from Trump’s bill.

headline: Robinhood Stock Flat in Trading. New Crypto Offerings Impress Wall Street.
summary: On Monday, at an event on the French Riviera, the company unveiled tokenized stocks and exchange-traded funds, crypto perpetual futures, crypto “staking,” and many other digital offerings for both U.S. and European customers.  In Tuesday’s afternoon trading,  Robinhood  gained 0.4% to $93.96.  A host of research notes praised Robinhood’s growing geographic footprint and rapid introduction of new offerings, making clear the company wants to position itself as a one-stop-shop financial services business.

headline: Robinhood Stock Is Falling. But New Crypto Offerings Impress Wall Street.
summary: Robinhood Markets stock turned lower Tuesday, but a series of crypto-related announcements the day before left Wall Street impressed.  On Monday, at a sun-drenched event on the French Riviera, the company unveiled products such as tokenized stocks and exchange-traded funds, crypto perpetual futures, crypto “staking,” and a slew of other digital offerings for both U.S. and European customers.  Robinhood  was slumping Tuesday, falling 3.7% to $90.16 after opening the session in the green.

Robinhood  was slumping Tuesday, falling 3.7% to $90.16 after opening the session in the green.

headline: Robinhood Target Hiked 83% On Tokenized Stock Launch
summary: Robinhood Markets' introduction of tokenized stock trading and other crypto offerings at a Monday event spurred a series of Wall Street price target hikes reported on Tuesday, including a massive 83% boost from KeyBanc.  HOOD rose modestly, after surging to an all-time high to start the week.  In a research report distilled by investment news site The Fly, KeyBanc took note of Robinhood's increased product breadth/depth and velocity in rolling out innovative new features that contribute to an expanded market opportunity.

In a research report distilled by investment news site The Fly, KeyBanc took note of Robinhood's increased product breadth/depth and velocity in rolling out innovative new features that contribute to an expanded market opportunity.

headline: Trump & Elon Musk, Apple AI, Robinhood: Trending Tickers
summary: US President Trump threatens to pull back Tesla's (TSLA) government subsidies after CEO and former Trump ally Elon Musk criticized the big, beautiful bill. Apple (AAPL) is reportedly considering using an external artificial intelligence (AI) language learning model (LLM) for Siri, like Anthropic (ANTH.PVT) or OpenAI (OPAI.PVT), according to reports from Bloomberg. The move would appear to be a concession for the iPhone maker in the AI race. Robinhood (HOOD) gains after launching tokenized US stocks and exchange-traded funds (ETFs) in the EU. Check out Yahoo Finance's full interview with the Robinhood CEO here. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Bitcoin, Ethereum Retreat. Why Crypto Is Trading Like Stocks, Not Gold.
summary: Cryptos often trade in line with technology stocks, and that relationship was holding early Tuesday.  Bitcoin, the oldest and largest digital coin, slipped 0.7% over the past 24 hours to $106,745, according to CoinDesk prices.  Digital assets were boosted last week by the cease-fire between Israel and Iran, which increased risk appetite.

headline: Crypto competition heats up, Kraken launches new payment app
summary: The crypto industry had a strong start to the year, as bitcoin (BTC-USD), shares of Coinbase (COIN), and Robinhood (HOOD) soared in the second quarter. As competition heats up, Kraken announced it's launching a new peer-to-peer payment app. Kraken (KRAK.PVT) Co-CEO Arjun Sethi joined Ramzan Karmali, explaining why this app will bring in a larger audience to the crypto space. Sethi also addressed the company's IPO plans saying, "If we think about going public, regardless of the timeline, it's gonna be in essence to be able to show continued transparency, and that that is in the best interest of our clients and our customers." To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief: Market Sunrise here

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Tesla, Robinhood, Coinbase, Wolfspeed, Progress Software, and More
summary: Investors were turning their attention to the Senate’s attempts to pass President Donald Trump’s tax-and-spending bill and global trade talks.  CEO Elon Musk criticized Trump’s bill, calling it “utterly insane and destructive,” while the president suggest that the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE)–the department Musk helped run until the end of May–should look into his companies’ government subsidies.  Robinhood Markets  was up 3.1% in premarket trading, a day after jumping 13% to a record high of $93.63 following the financial-services platform’s introduction of a series of new crypto-focused offerings to users in the U.S. and Europe.

Robinhood Markets  was up 3.1% in premarket trading, a day after jumping 13% to a record high of $93.63 following the financial-services platform’s introduction of a series of new crypto-focused offerings to users in the U.S. and Europe.

headline: Robinhood CEO: Investors see opportunity outweighing uncertainty
summary: The S&P 500 (^GSPC) and the Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC) ended the first half of 2025 at record highs despite looming uncertainties including Trump's tariff policies, geopolitical tensions, the timing of the Federal Reserve's next interest rate cut, and more. Robinhood (HOOD) CEO and chairman Vlad Tenev shares some insights into recent retail investor sentiment on Market Domination with Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi. Check out Yahoo Finance's full interview with the Robinhood CEO here. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Global Dollar (USDG) Launches in the EU
summary: Global Dollar (USDG), a global stablecoin regulated by EU's Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA), the Finnish Financial Supervisory Authority (FIN-FSA), and the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS), is launching to consumers across the European Union today. Backed by Global Dollar Network (GDN) and issued by Paxos, USDG is a fully compliant, global stablecoin and is now available in this market, opening up access to over 450 million consumers in 30 countries.
